qas.question: By what age had many small states covered the subcontinent?
How many small states covered the Ganges Plain of India?
What were the sixteen kingdoms called?
What second period did the rise of the small kingdoms show?
What was the first major urbanization in India?

context: In the <a0_0>later Vedic Age<a0_0/>, a number of small kingdoms or city states had covered the subcontinent, many mentioned in Vedic, early Buddhist and Jaina literature as far back as 500 BCE. <a1_0>sixteen monarchies<a1_0/> and "republics" known as the <a2_0>Mahajanapadas<a2_0/>—Kashi, Kosala, Anga, Magadha, Vajji (or Vriji), Malla, Chedi, Vatsa (or Vamsa), Kuru, Panchala, Matsya (or Machcha), Shurasena, Assaka, Avanti, Gandhara, and Kamboja—stretched across the Indo-Gangetic Plain from modern-day Afghanistan to Bengal and Maharashtra. This period saw the second major rise of <a3_0>urbanism<a3_0/> in India after the <a4_0>Indus Valley Civilisation<a4_0/>.
